column24:
Listed below are a number of difficult or stressful things that sometimes happen to people. For each event
check one or more of the boxes to the right to indicate events. Be sure to consider your entire life (growing up as well as adulthood) as you go through the list of events.

column2: Clinical Dementia Rating (CDR) Scale - Forget major event scale
column5:
Scale to rate whether the subject completely forgets a major event (e.g. a trip, a party,
 a family wedding) within a few weeks of the event from the informant's perspective, as a part of the Clinical Dementia Rating (CDR) Scale.
column6:
Scale to rate whether the subject completely forgets a major event (e.g. a trip, a party,
 a family wedding) within a few weeks of the event from the informant's perspective, as a part of the Clinical Dementia Rating (CDR) Scale.
column24: Choose one. This is a semi-structured interview. Please ask all of these questions. Ask any additional questions necessary to determine the subjectCDR. Please note information from additional questions.
column26: Does he/she completely forget a major event (e.g. a trip, a party, a family wedding) within a few weeks of the event?
